Description: Fragment of floor of black-figured pottery plate; underside reserved, heavily ridged. On floor, part of animal frieze, perhaps bird to right; to the outside, glazed band with added red and white lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität Band 3 (p.109 pl. 137.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1145)
